# US5.3: Forward One Sentence Per Click

## State
COMMITTED

## Problem Statement
Children may want to skip boring parts or move ahead if they've already read a section. A simple "Next Sentence" button similar to the "Back One Sentence" button provides this control without complex scrubbing. This button should be directly to the right of the back button.

## User Story
As a child I want to skip ahead one sentence per click so that I can move faster. This should work similar to the "Back One Sentence" button with debounce logic. I would prefer the caching to be similar to the "Back One Sentence" button and not be eager to load the next sentence until I have stopped clicking. There should be a 500ms delay before loading the next sentence to prevent race conditions and unnecessary fetching to be cost conscious.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [x] **AC1**: Forward button jumps to next sentence.
- [x] **AC2**: Highlighting updates immediately.
- [x] **AC3**: Audio restarts from the beginning of that sentence.

## Non-Functional Requirements
- Responsiveness (Seek time < 100ms)
